intro: Sphaeradenia chiriquensis, commonly known as the Central American star vine, is a climbing plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red berries containing seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
